Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Thu May 26 15:50:17 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Landfall; Suborbital Pod System]
The suborbital pod station rivals the spaceport as the busiest location on the
planet. Although your status as a pilot provides you with a rather limited
travel pass, millions of other citizens are passing through here daily on their
way to any one of the planet's cities.
You can go southwest.

nears the surface.

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Control Room]
You can go south and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
ftl endymion
You must launch before using the FTL drive.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Starlight Express, you have clearance
to launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl endymion
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.

Express! Welcome to home space!"

General Starship status:
HULL PLATING:                                                                   
    EAOS Plasma Resistant Plating (225 damage absorption points) (modified to
100% by hull size and rated at 100% of nominal) (Moderate resistance to
minicannons)
REACTIONLESS DRIVE:                                                             
    EAOS Dual Reactionless Mk III (Instantaneous velocity: 6000km/s, Maximum
velocity: 24000 km/s, Acceleration Rating: 25.0, Complete Deceleration in 5
seconds) (Running at 100% rated efficiency and 0% rated maximum velocity)
MAIN SENSORS:                                                                   
    EAOS Superstring Perturbation Sensor (Hull Lockon Rate: 25% Wormhole Drive
Lockon Rate: 50% Cloak Resolution Distance: 1 unit)
WEAPONS (Turrets):                                                              
    Frontier Anti-Hazard Laser is operating at 3 damage per turret (100% of
rated) and is operating at 100% of rated efficiency (Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s)
STORAGE:                                                                        
    Zero-G Cargo Netting (100% of standard)
MAIN BATTERY:                                                                   
    Revo Applied Technology Sink (Overall Efficiency: 100% Combat Grid Usage:
100% Wormhole Drive Usage: 100% Max Engine Speed: 6000km/s) (Maximum Charge:
100% of standard) (Drain Rate: n/a)
COMBAT ENERGY GRID:                                                             
    Telex Defense "Jackrabbit" Combat Accelerator (Capacity: 1100 Time To
Recharge: 200 seconds)  (modified to 100% by hull size)
TARGET TRACKING ARRAY:                                                          
    Luna Improved TT Array (Maximum Targets: 1 Range: 2 units Near Target
Retention: 100% Far Target Retention: 50%)
LIFE SUPPORT:                                                                   
    Inactive
SALVAGING EQUIPMENT:
  Salvage range:                                                                
    Normal
  Sensor:                                                                       
    stock salvage sensor (Range: 1)
  EMM:                                                                          
    stock salvage electromagnetic manipulator (Response Time: 3.0s)

    stock salvage grapple (Grade: 0 Strength: 4 Bonus Grade: 0)
MISCELLANEOUS ADD-ONS:
  none

n

launch

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.

voice, "Detecting vessel 'Starlight Express.' Welcome to Capella."
rd
Capella (EAOS) [Human Interalliance Space] (Security: Beta-2)
Coordinate rundown:
Starships: Starlight Express (p) at (15, 3, 6)

[General Communication] Blake Madison transmits, "Yep."

that funny fake German accent for everything."

Would you like to request docking clearance for Capella Station?

y
You notify flight control of your desire to dock.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "We detect you to be an AEU ship,
Starlight Express. The EAOS welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
power
Life support cannot be without power while this ship is in a hostile
environment.
out
You scramble to your feet.
[Starship "Starlight Express"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
use shooting
You are not currently wearing a spacesuit. Do you wish to suit up now?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You remove spacesuit components from a black flightbag with a red shooting star
on the side and quickly don them.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
You exit the ship.

The four-person star liner "Starlight Express" is landed here.
You can go north.
You are weightless here.

You see a large PANEL of environmental controls here. Lights overhead indicate
that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is at Capella Station; Docking Bay. The hatch appears to be locked. A small
green light near the hatch marks that the airlock currently possesses a safe
environment.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

Express! Welcome to home space!"

AutoStar (general-purpose starship autopilot) Version 9.1
--
Destinations in this sector:
   Planets:
[1] New Earth                           
   Space Stations:
[2] Space Station Alpha                 
   Space Markets:
[3] Space Market                        
--
Enter your destination:
[Type a line of input or `@abort' to abort the command.]
1
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Starlight Express. We read your
AEU transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
out
You scramble to your feet.
[Starship "Starlight Express"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The four-person star liner "Starlight Express" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
enter dove
You key in a transport of William Dove to your location.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is slowly brought in
aboard an automated flatbed, then lowered to the floor.

woven of large dark green fern fronds, and a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo
chow bowl here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter dove

You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor

black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and

table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a high tech

containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid

large fuchsia felo here.

l
[Starship "Starlight Express"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a glossy pearl gray ceramic felo chow bowl, a big red armored felo, an
obese red horned felo, Maria Mitchell the humanoid service robot, and a large
red soldier felo here.
You can go south and out.
Lily Kaise glides in from the south.

repair 11
Syntax:
  REPAIR <component>
  Such as: repair hull
  Or:      repair launcher 2
  Or:      repair stop
Valid components are: hull, sensors, FTL, launcher, turret, or STOP

[Starship "The Shame Squad Prevails"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair and an improved temporary
wormhole drive here.
You can go north and south.
(You are sitting.)
Melinda Michaels's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Yup, two is
good."
Akemi Bando's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Did you get ammo
Melinda?"

The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space.

Starseekers
--
General Information
  Purpose:            When the hard work of the day is done, and you are looking
for a place to meet friends. When things become boring and you can't wait to see
something new. Then there is Starseekers, a cool, relaxing place to hang out,
meet old and new friends, and experience something new. Every pilot who believes
there's more to life than points and credits will be welcome here!
  Slogan:             "There's always something new beyond the next star."
  Founder:             Kim Saunders
  Trustees:            Angel Martin and Shule Elemmire
  Members:             9
  Total Members:       12
  Total Active:        9
  Founded on:          22 May 2312
  Public:              Yes
  Recruiting:          Yes
Unity
  Member Alliances:    AEU, League, and Fringe
  Unity:               81%
Assets
  Credits on Hand:     70,361,763,091.20 EAOS credits
  Starship Insurance:  367,858,858.20 EAOS credits
  Support Fund:        571,111,110.00 EAOS credits
  Starships Owned:     18
  Starships Supported: 2 of 14
  Support Cost:        160,000,000.00 EAOS credits
  Megacredits:         662
  Member Megacredits:  300

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a high tech
silver star print holovid, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a clear plastic food storage container, a small yellow ball
containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, and Xavier the big silver soldier
felo here.

You say, "Yeah, me too."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Oh I typically use quickpatches on the
hull and if I can manually repair the rest of the components I do. The
quickpatch will typically repair the hull at least by one more percentage than
the restoration tool overall."
'Yeah, that's what I've noticed.
You say, "Yeah, that's what I've noticed."
'And that's what I typically do.
You say, "And that's what I typically do."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Or if I have a component that is badly
damaged and the hull is ok, I'll apply a quickpatch sometimes."
nod
You nod.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "I could be totally wrong though haha."
laugh
You laugh.
'Well, it's what I do.
You say, "Well, it's what I do."
Shasta the big onyx soldier felo marches out.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "It also obviously saves you on your
supplies as the quickpatch requires less replicators."
'If the hull is getting close to a failsafe, I'll often quickpatch it.
You say, "If the hull is getting close to a failsafe, I'll often quickpatch it."
Lily Kaise nods.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "That's also a good idea just to get it
repaired a bit faster and I do that as well after I start the manual repair of
it if I can."
'Yeah, that's what I do too.
You say, "Yeah, that's what I do too."
'Especially if rapids are involved and the hull gets hit.
You say, "Especially if rapids are involved and the hull gets hit."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "But if we're getting hit a lot, I just
use a restoration as I don't want to take time to peruse the damage report as we
could get hit again and it oculd wipe out a failsafe."
nod
You nod.
Lily Kaise nods.
'ok, so I'm not totally far off with what I'm doing.
You say, "Ok, so I'm not totally far off with what I'm doing."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Heh well I may be telling you wrong."
Lily Kaise laughs.
laugh
You laugh.
'Nah, Cesar seems to trust you the most as engineer.
You say, "Nah, Cesar seems to trust you the most as engineer."
Lily Kaise exclaims in a New Earth accent, "Haha you serious!"
'Yeah, he made a comment once that it's nice to have someone in engineering that
you don't have to worry about cause you know they know what they're doing. He
was referring to you.
You say, "Yeah, he made a comment once that it's nice to have someone in
engineering that you don't have to worry about cause you know they know what
they're doing. He was referring to you."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Well I do try to stay up with things too
as I've seen a lot who don't even recharge very often."
Shasta the big onyx soldier felo marches in from the airlock.
'Yeah
You say, "Yeah."
A Tardick lizard named Asteria, perched on Lily Kaise's shoulder, blinks its
yellow eyes slowly, utterly indifferent to its surroundings.
pet shasta
You stroke the soft fur of Shasta the big onyx soldier felo.
Shasta the big onyx soldier felo purrs and rubs its head against your hand,
looking up at you adoringly.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a clear plastic food storage
container, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, and
a high tech silver star print holovid here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
From a high tech silver star print holovid: The woman's hand traces lightly over
the item, highlighting its features.
From a high tech silver star print holovid: The camera pans slowly over a
braided golden brown leather belt with a star-shaped brass buckle. This belt is
constructed of flat, closely braided strips of leather. Though the material has
the texture and slight variations of color found in old-fashioned animal-based
leather, a small tag on the inside states that it is '100% synthleather.'
Centered at the front is a star-shaped brass buckle. This belt is designed for
wear with garments that cover the waist.
From a high tech silver star print holovid: The woman says, "When you order,
you'll have your choice of buckle shape. Today, we have available square, round,
oval, and star-shaped."
From a high tech silver star print holovid: The woman says, "I've really been
looking forward to showing off this item."
From a high tech silver star print holovid: The woman exclaims, "You would
expect to pay 140, 160, or even 320 credits for this item!"
From a high tech silver star print holovid: The woman says, "Usually, we list
this item for 79.99 credits."
From a high tech silver star print holovid: The woman exclaims, "But today, for
a limited time only, we're proud to offer this item for just 39.99 credits!
That's right, only 39.99 EAOS credits!"

now to place your order!"

the item, highlighting its features.

braided golden brown leather belt with a star-shaped brass buckle. This belt is
constructed of flat, closely braided strips of leather. Though the material has
the texture and slight variations of color found in old-fashioned animal-based
leather, a small tag on the inside states that it is '100% synthleather.'
Centered at the front is a star-shaped brass buckle. This belt is designed for
wear with garments that cover the waist.

[Chetumal Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Sheets of tinted glass form a transparent window into the outside world around
this crescent-shaped lounge, giving you a clear view to both the landing pad and
the surrounding mountains and other Chetumalian scenery. Comfortable couches are
spaced in neat clusters for pilots to sit in as they socialize and are brought
refreshments by the attractive waitresses. Scattered close to the groups of
couches are multiple holovids tuned to the latest news, captions scrolling
around the edges. A stairway towards the back of the room has its door open and
bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a gleaming granite-topped bar, a public holovid, and a brightly-lit
candy vending machine here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

Morris Corlew just arrived.
peer out
You peer out...
[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The two-person medium transport "Registered Merchant 834", the one-person
fighter "You Can Go Boom Now", the four-person star liner "Starlight Express",
and the two-person Accord gemini "Lunar Eclipse" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, and a trash
can here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and down.
Morris Corlew sits down on a comfortable black leather couch.
Lily Kaise waves.
wave

Morris Corlew waves.

transport "Registered Merchant 834" lift off of the landing pad and ascend into
space.

[Starship "Siegebreaker"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a fuzzy stuffed octopus and a black leather captain's chair here.
Blake Madison, Akemi Bando, Lily Kaise, Damien Alexander, Morris Corlew, and Ali
Candan are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Hello there, Fringe Navy
Flitter Corps Orange 4! Welcome to home space!"
Karasi Valhannon ambles in from the south.
Blake Madison presses some buttons on the communication board.
Karasi Valhannon says in a Martian accent, "Oh."

"Greetings."

standard signal at this ship: "Greetings."
Via general sector communication, Fringe Navy Flitter Corps Orange 5 directs a
standard signal at this ship: "Greetings."
Via general sector communication, Fringe Navy Flitter Corps Orange 4 directs a
standard signal at this ship: "Greetings."

palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.

'We shall break the siege.
You say, "We shall break the siege."
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
Blake Madison presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.

"Hello, Siegebreaker. Welcome to Accord space."

l
[Starship "Siegebreaker"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair here.
You can go east.

nice."

Akemi at the helm."

please do not hurt me."
Damien Alexander's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Nobody else
wanted to fly? I'll take second mission."

cruiser."

rattling noise against the hull.

horrible if something went wrong."

[Starship "Siegebreaker"; Weapons Room Two]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair here.
Blake Madison is sitting on a swiveling black leather gunner's chair.

head out to the next mission."

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
5Hzm^dFu{n]BzQQ\-zo^]|n!A)~_{YqPU$w\ON/E
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

riftflow conditions are 3114 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Westsouthwest and Very Slightly Down."

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a high tech silver star print holovid, a clear
plastic food storage container, a compact red refrigerator, and a blue plastic
food storage container here.

New Earth Orbit (AEU) [Human Interalliance Space] (Security: Alpha-1)
Coordinate rundown:
Starships: William Dove (M) at (5, 2, 8)
Planets: (5, 14, 16)

green
You lift a small plastic cover and press a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.
rd
New Earth Orbit (AEU) [Human Interalliance Space] (Security: Alpha-1)
Coordinate rundown:
Starships: William Dove (M) at (5, 2, 8)
Planets: (5, 14, 16)
Space Stations: (12, 9, 14)
Space Markets: (7, 6, 10)
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a high tech silver star print holovid, a clear
plastic food storage container, a compact red refrigerator, and a blue plastic
food storage container here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "S'sec need to figure out the bubble
beacon."
'That's fine
You say, "That's fine."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "I don't see it on the reference."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Lily Kaise asks in a New Earth accent, "Take your time Hun but please go check
the range office if you can?"
You notice Lily Kaise using the radio to ask for landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, William Dove. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
'Sure
You say, "Sure."
out
Lily Kaise pulls a large lever towards her.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
You scramble to your feet.

chow bowl here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a high tech silver star print holovid, a clear
plastic food storage container, a compact red refrigerator, and a blue plastic
food storage container here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.

reference."

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ooc Heh. Nah, I can cook and do multiple things at once.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
You say, OOCly, "Heh. Nah, I can cook and do multiple things at once."
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
;6V@~}?G)qVrF>iUl8,6gpn#KU)>Zm~0m(<)>RvK
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 3110 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Westsouthwest and Very Slightly Down."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'William Dove.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
'Go sector west
You say, "Go sector west."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Beta 287."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
'oh
You say, "Oh."
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
The mist turns to black smoke that soon drifts away, and you find that the ship
is on a conveyor belt, moving rapidly through a factory.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Oops."
'The accelerator is one sector west of Belt of Orion.
You say, "The accelerator is one sector west of Belt of Orion."
Lily Kaise presses a button on the rift drive control board, and the starship
begins dropping out of the riftflow.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel cancelled."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
'Go to 025
You say, "Go to 025."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Home Beacon Alpha 025."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
'Alpha 025
You say, "Alpha 025."
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.

direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

FTL Interalliance Communications Network

Subject: bubble
Author: Melinda Michaels
Posted: 19:10 15 June 2316 GST
--
Your normal bubble travels will be fixed between now and a few days. We have
replaced the passive beacon but there may be a conflict with the marker beacon.
So, we may have to wait till it sorts itself out. Also, we will be combining the
xeno and salvage stations out at the belt of Orion in a few days. This will mean
that we will be dumping salvage into the furnace to maintain the station on a
daily basis. So, I hope that pilots don't mind helping out with that while they
earn a few credits.
If you have any questions, complaints or whatever, give me a shout.
Melinda
--

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a high tech silver star print holovid, a clear
plastic food storage container, a compact red refrigerator, and a blue plastic
food storage container here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a high tech silver star print holovid, a clear
plastic food storage container, a compact red refrigerator, a blue plastic food
storage container, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and Shasta the big onyx
soldier felo here.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 9
Exploration Ships:
Two-Person Scout 3,750,000.00 (bikura)
AY-71 AEU LONG-RANGE SCOUT
Class: Scout
Requirements: 10 industry points        0 combat points
Model number: AY-71                     Designation: Scout
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 8000         Standard battery hours: 18
Docking bay size required: 12.5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
The two-person exploration scout is the AEU pilot's usual choice for
exploration. Outfitted with the right battery, it can go for a very long time.
It is also small, comfortable and reasonably well armed so it can hold its own
against a minor enemy force. Some of the later and larger ships will be able to
hold more charge, but the scout seems to be many a pilot's choice regardless.
If a pilot has the right amount of points (100 industry, 100 space combat and 10
exploration), they can upgrade their exploration scout now into an advanced
scout at a shop named Emerging Technologies on New Earth. This advanced scout is
still an exploration vessel, but more heavily armed than the initial design.
However, you also lose a significant portion of your battery charge when
upgrading to this level of scout.
Two-Person Void Piercer 660,000,000.00 (endymion Revo Technologies)
RDT-E1M9S REVO DEVELOPMENTAL TECHNOLOGIES VOID PIERCER
Class: Scout
Requirements: 1000 industry points      1250 exploration points
Model number: RDT-E1M9S                 Designation: Void Piercer
Turret hardpoints: 0                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 12000        Standard battery hours: 24
Docking bay size required: 12.5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
The Void Piercer has six hours more than the exploration scout in standard
charge, and seems to go slightly faster. Aside from that though, it seems to for
the most part be unremarkable from the exploration scout. The expensiveness is
due to the cost of needing to re-research the information which led to the
ship's construction since the original prototype was stolen.
One-Person Vostok 250,000,000.00 (Farport the Black room)
ME-3Q/X-42 EAOS-MUTUALITY-TANDEM VOSTOK-CLASS EXPERIMENTAL RIFT CAPSULE
Class: Capsule
Requirements: 1500 industry points      0 combat points
Model number: ME-3Q/X-42                Designation: Vostok
Turret hardpoints: 1                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 0            Standard battery hours: 48
Docking bay size required: 2.5
Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 150%               Max Cruising Speed: 150%
This ship is capable of going far deeper into the rift than any other ship. As a
result, it moves ssignificantly faster than any other vessel currently available
that is equipped with a rift drive, and comes with one already installed.
Furthermore, this ship is not very good at locating points of interest until it
is practically on top of them, though some tests have shown that if you decrease
your speed, you're able to detect things from farther out. You cannot do any
manual moving in this ship, and you cannot leave it in hostile environments
since it does not have an airlock.
Two-Person Arrow (approval required) (Aenea)
AY-72 AEU ARROW-CLASS EXTREME-RANGE SCOUT
Class: Scout (Limited Alliance Support)
Requirements: 3500 industry points      1500 exploration points
Model number: AY-72                     Designation: Arrow
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 12000        Standard battery hours: 36
Docking bay size required: 12.5
   Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
This is a prewar alliance exploration vessel, and is virtually unremarkable from
other exploration vessels except for a few things. The biggest thing is that it
has a subwarp drive. This subwarp drive basically creates a mini wormhole which
can get you from one part of the sector to any coordinates within the sector you
designate. So, if you want to get to a station which is located at 5, 4, 2 you
would set the subwarp drive on a set of coordinates that is one unit away from
the station. For example, 6, 4, 2 or 4, 4, 2 etc. In addition to the subwarp
drive, the arrow also has a very nice battery on it which with present upgrades,
can make the ship have a good, three solid days of charge if you play your cards
right. However, you will have to fill out an application if you ever want to own
one, and approval or denial notifications can take a while to get to you. You
will be notified by mail one way or the other.
Five-Person Magnetar (Explorer Corps only) (Aenea)
AY-9X AEU MAGNETAR-CLASS EXPLORATION VESSEL
Class: Gunship (Limited Alliance Support)
Requirements: 5000 industry points      2500 exploration points
Model number: AY-9X                     Designation: Magnetar
Turret hardpoints: 9                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 32000        Standard battery hours: 38
Docking bay size required: 60           Docking bay capacity: 25
Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
Little is known about this ship, as only members of the explorer corps can get
one, and no one I presently know of is a member of the explorer corps. So, until
we can get further details about the vessel from someone in the explorer corps,
please refer to the information about it written above.

Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers, a
long-sleeved dark green tee appliqued with small silver stars, a pair of relaxed
fit light khaki cargo pants, a pair of white cotton briefs, and a pair of black
socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a
black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver
metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a
black guitar case, a reactionless spacesuit jet, and a spacesuit navaid. You are
concealing a leather briefcase, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag
with a red shooting star on the side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply
kit, a flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology
container, a black engineering tool case, a thick synthleather bandolier with
large pockets, and a scorched metal thigh holster. Your face, both eyes, and
neck are left uncovered.
You are carrying a dense dodecahedron-shaped metallic mass in your right hand.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.

Soothsayer t-shirt. On the front of this white t-shirt is a full-color depiction
of a shiny, silver-colored AEU Soothsayer cruiser engaged in a furious space
battle with several Outsider and Thrall ships. The Soothsayer's lasers and
plasma minicannons are blazing out in all directions, impacting their targets
with devastating effect. In the midst of the debris of several destroyed
Outsider ships, one Thrall starship is in the process of exploding under fire
from several of the Soothsayer's blue-beamed lasers, its restricting chain
shattering into pieces around it. On the other side of the AEU cruiser, a very
large Outsider ship is cracking apart under the deadly onslaught of all three of
the Soothsayer's plasma minicannons. Through a viewport in front of the cruiser,
you can see the silhouette of the Soothsayer's pilot as she deftly flies her
ship between trails of weapon's fire from the remaining enemy ships. There is
little doubt as to the outcome of this battle, as the Soothsayer has taken no
damage at all from the Outsider vessels.

From a high tech silver star print holovid: The woman's hand traces lightly over
the item, highlighting its features.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.

Battery-Powered Temporary Station; Docking Bay.

She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average, naturally
shaped breasts with prominent rosy nipples. Her abdomen is attractive and
punctuated by a cute navel. More intimately, she has soft pale honey blonde
pubic hair and a girlish butt. Her face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose
and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush pink and occasionally part
to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are
blue-green and almond-shaped. Her mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey
blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval
pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a
slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at League Xenological
Battery-Powered Temporary Station; Docking Bay.
You see a long plasteel counter, a pair of narrow bunks, a small seashell pink
trash can, a turquoise rattan dresser with brass handles and a glass-covered
top, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a glossy sapphire blue
ceramic felo chow bowl, and a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped
headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a
soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made
purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it here.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate

launch

rift start
You flip a number of failsafe switches on the rift drive control board, then
push a heavy lever forward.
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
You mentally sigh in relief as you return to the starship.

--

Direction:          Galactic East (0.0, 0.0)
Riftflow:           5197 light-mincycles per seccycle from Galactic North and
Slightly Up
Forecast:           Within the next 0.500, the riftflow is predicted to remain
the same intensity and direction.
Time in Riftflow:   0.00H
Distance Traveled:  73.79 light-cycles
Apparent Region:    Known Space
--
rift heading 180 -2
You quickly turn a small wheel on the rift drive control board.
The starship suddenly lurches in a new direction. Something must be wrong with
the inertial dampeners.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a high tech silver star print holovid, a clear
plastic food storage container, a compact red refrigerator, and a blue plastic
food storage container here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, and a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo
chow bowl here.
You can go enter into the ship.

the hatch, and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit
the floor as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."

black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, Purr the humanoid service robot, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a high tech silver star print holovid, a
compact red refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, and Bert the hefty blue soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.

i
 You are wearing a gold spacesuit helmet, a black spacesuit top with a red star
on the right shoulder, a pair of black spacesuit gloves with a gold stripe
around each cuff, a black spacesuit bottom with a red stripe down the outside of
each leg, and a pair of black spacesuit boots with a gold stripe down each side.
Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of gray canvas sneakers, a short-sleeved
oceanside blue linen shirt, a pair of slim Sahara sand linen trousers, and a
pair of white cotton briefs. You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic gold
touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, a reactionless spacesuit jet, and a
spacesuit navaid. You are concealing a leather briefcase, a golden Feng Wo coin
purse, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a camera bag, an
asteroid hauling supply kit, a flight control scanner, a large expandable
telescoping xenology container, a black engineering tool case, a thick
synthleather bandolier with large pockets, and a scorched metal thigh holster.
Your face, both eyes, and neck are left uncovered.
You are carrying an unfamiliar spherical component in your right hand.
Lily Kaise makes a selection on the AutoVector control board.

Proper in-sector coordinates not reached.  AutoVector program aborted.
ftl 287
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Beta 287."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

wait.

You hand a large expandable telescoping xenology container to the nearest

l me
Shule Elemmire
He appears to be 26 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
olive skin. His body is athletic with muscled hips and strong calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a wide chest. His face is average-shaped and
handsome, with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and
occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched
eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and round. His chin-length, straight hair is
blonde and neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side.
 He is wearing a black spacesuit top with a red star on the right shoulder, a
pair of black spacesuit gloves with a gold stripe around each cuff, a black
spacesuit bottom with a red stripe down the outside of each leg, and a pair of
black spacesuit boots with a gold stripe down each side. He is also wearing a
keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator,
a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, a reactionless
spacesuit jet, and a spacesuit navaid. His head, face, both eyes, and neck are
left uncovered.
He is carrying a gold spacesuit helmet in his right hand.
put helm in shooting
You put a gold spacesuit helmet in a black flightbag with a red shooting star on
the side.
use shooting

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.

deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.

direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

You peer out...
[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The five-person torpedo boat "When The Devil Calls" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north and down.
Damien Alexander's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "An' away we go."
peer n
You peer north...
[Starship "When The Devil Calls"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You can go south and down.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.

2
You order a white Soothsayer t-shirt.
l shirt
a short-sleeved oceanside blue linen shirt
Constructed of fine oceanside blue linen, this shirt has a slim fit through the
chest, arms, and waist. It also has a pointed collar, matching buttons, and a
clean pocketless front for a casual, natural style.
l soothsayer
a white Soothsayer t-shirt
On the front of this white t-shirt is a full-color depiction of a shiny,
silver-colored AEU Soothsayer cruiser engaged in a furious space battle with
several Outsider and Thrall ships. The Soothsayer's lasers and plasma
minicannons are blazing out in all directions, impacting their targets with
devastating effect. In the midst of the debris of several destroyed Outsider
ships, one Thrall starship is in the process of exploding under fire from
several of the Soothsayer's blue-beamed lasers, its restricting chain shattering
into pieces around it. On the other side of the AEU ship, a very large Outsider
ship is cracking apart under the deadly onslaught of all three of the
Soothsayer's plasma minicannons. Through a viewport in front of the AEU cruiser,
you can see the silhouette of the pilot as he deftly flies his ship between
trails of weapon's fire from the remaining enemy ships. There is little doubt as
to the outcome of this battle, as the Soothsayer has taken no damage at all from
the Outsider vessels.
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Great, we've
almost reached our first performance goal! Keep it up!"

You order a white Pulsar t-shirt.
l t-shirt
a white Pulsar t-shirt
On the front of this white t-shirt is a full-color image of a shiny,
silver-colored AEU Pulsar gunship engaged in battle with several Outsider ships
in the space over New Earth. The Pulsar's glowing green lasers and plasma
minicannons are blazing out toward the Outsiders in righteous fury, each one
impacting its target ship with devastating effect. Through a viewport in front
of the Pulsar, you can see the silhouette of the pilot as he directs his
gunners' deadly fire against the Outsiders, all the while maneuvering his swift
ship between the trails of torpedo and laser fire from the remaining enemy
ships. There is little doubt as to the outcome of this battle, as the Pulsar has
taken no damage at all from the Outsider ships.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 10
Module Transports:
Four-Person Accord Space Module Transport 20000000.00 (AFW Command)
AFW SPACE MODULE TRANSPORT
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 20 industry points      0 combat points
Model number: AFW-063                   Designation: Accord Space Module
Transport
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 12000        Standard battery hours: 18
Docking bay size required: 160
This ship will allow you to move around temporary space station modules and
position them properly so that you can create a temporary space structure in the
sector of your choice. Despite being a light cruiser, this vessel does not have
a docking bay, replacing the dockin bay with the module bay. It can hold up to
28 temporary space station modules.
Two-Person Accord Space Module Scout 20,000,000.00 (AFW Command)
AFW SPACE MODULE SCOUT
Class: Scout
Requirements: 20 industry points        300 exploration points
Model number: AFW-071                   Designation: Accord Space Module Scout
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 4000         Standard battery hours: 20
Docking bay size required: 60
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
This ship, though smaller than its cousin and able to fit only seven temporary
space station modules has two hours more charge, and also has an exploration
point requirement. Even with this exploration point requirement however, it does
not seem like this ship has exploration-grade sensors, and cannot be fitted with
an impeller upgrade.
AC-2X SPACE CONSTRUCTOR 100,000,000.00 (Aenea)
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 2500 industry points
Model number: AC-2X                     Designation: Space Constructor
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 10000        Standard battery hours: 12
Docking bay size required: 225
This vessel is able to hold 28 temporary space station modules, just like the
module transport. However, this particular design which is currently only
available to the AEU, has the added benefits of not needing space lifters at all
for temporary station construction. This is because you can construct the
temporary stations from inside the docking bay, and thenjust push the station
itself out when you need to. It appears that you can have more than one
temporary station constructed and ready for deployment in the module bay at any
given time, but the modules used in the construction will still count towards
the module bay's total limit.

Lily Kaise uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
[General Communication] Lillian Hudson transmits, "Maybe we don't get to buy
super secret new super duper repairing and fixing upping tech."
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
[General Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "Fear not, for Ather Jammoa is
on the hunt."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
CLyz{rb1}$}1.>Krqbs"2##-2ec}`mQ4V+IiG!Y(
[General Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "Now, the rest of you, find out
where I can buy a spider."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "There or on helios too."
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2547 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Northnortheast and Up."
Lily Kaise presses a button, calling up the coordinate rundown, and studies it
for a moment.
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-82 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'William Dove.' Welcome to Tannhauser Gate."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Agnarr's Interstellar
Siege Force Rental-in-a-Box 343.

Blueprint for a Humanoid Service Robot:
Required supplies: humanoid robot chassis: 1, small self-sustaining power
source: 1, articulated robotic hand: 2, and robot controller: 1

and robotic eye: 2

optical lens: 1

read second paper
--
Starseekers expedition Information
 
Hello,
I write this letter to you to confirm that you are on the crew list of the
expedition I am organizing. this letter also contains some information about the
trip.
 
- we wil be traveling aboard Akemi's science vessel, which she kindly has made
available for this occasion. akemi will hand out keys just before departure. we
will bring a few other ships along, keys for these will be handed out if and as
needed.
- We will start gathering for departure on the first of June at 23:00 GST. we
wil meet on Old Earth in the coffee shop. this coffee shop is located in the
spaceport, between the landing pad and the south point exit. We are aiming for a
departure time of 23:59 GST.
- You should be prepared for a trip that will take roughly 2 weeks. Melinda has
made various food and drink dispensers available, but it might be nice if you
brought a small amount of food for greater variety.
- to keep it fair for everyone, and to make sure we can bring a full crew,
everyone is allowed to bring only 1 pet felo. If you choose to bring one, you
are also required to bring a felo spacesuit for it.
- we will have a few crew members who have never been on an expedition like
this. If you do not have any rift drive repair tools yet, do not worry. akemi
has spare tools available and we will still have time to craft more of such
tools.
- As of the time of this writing, the crew for this expedition is as follows:
Akemi, anfisa, Melinda, Lillian, shule, Lily, Nissi, Liam, Michael, Blake,
simon, Nathaniel, Morris, Sakura, Zandria and myself. 
 
should you have any questions that I have not answered in this letter, feel free
to contact me and ask. also if you are not sure you are still awake during the
gathering and departure time, talk to me or Akemi and we will make arrangements
with you.
I am sure we are all looking forward to a fun expedition, and see you tomorrow!
take care,
Kim (Starseekers founder)
--
read third paper
--
Shule, I'm sitting on the couch in the Control Room of William Dove. I have
Magellan, Sassie on a leash and a hoverpallet following me. I put the aquariums
onto the hoverpallet. please put the bed on the hoverpallet as well. I'd prefer
not to take William Dove to old Earth and it be there for all that long but if
you forget and take us there, it's ok. If you have any extra felo chow bowls or
troughs, please bring them along with any fish food you have or felo chow. I
have put an extra bag of chow in Maria Mitchell who is in your ship and I did a
felo feeding from the Repair shop so your felo will be taken care of. Purr is
setup with 4 bags of chow plus the fish food it has in case an aquarium is left
behind. please take a look around in William Dove and pick up anything you see
that I might have overlooked. The last thing I need to do is pick up some food
to bring. please bring any that you have time to get. I should be back no later
than 2300 and can easily pickup food. I'm just planning for contingencies in
case I over sleep. Love you, - Lily
--

[Space Station "Helios"; Docking Bay Alpha]
The outer end of this large interior docking bay is ringed with bright white
docking lights and red and yellow warning stripes. The walls are dark grey
metal, scarred and burned in places, but recessed into them and apparently fully
functional are the automated systems that assist starship launching, docking,
and transport into the garage below. A hatch-like entryway leads east into the
station.
The six-person A.S.S. frigate "Emerald McKay" and the five-person A.S.S.
tactical platform "William Dove" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a trash can here.

l
[Starship "Emerald McKay"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space.
You see a large leather chair here.
You can go north, up, and down.
