l emerald
the six-person A.S.S. frigate "Emerald McKay"
You see a frigate here.
"Emerald McKay" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "ASS-F1" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is somewhat dull and painted a white color with gunmetal grey trim. Its
laser turrets are blackened and outlined in gunmetal grey. The bays of its
minicannon launchers are dented and painted gunmetal grey. Its landing struts
are clean and painted gunmetal grey.
It has a smooth dome on the forward end.
enter emerald
[Starship "Emerald McKay"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter emerald

You see a black leather captain's chair, a large leather couch, a decoy beacon
launcher, and a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south and out.
power

The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.

support
The "support" command is used for all in-game issues of any type, including
bugs, typos, discussions about ongoing roleplaying, and requests for urgent
assistance.
Do you wish to submit a support request to the staff?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
Please enter a brief subject for your support request, summarizing your issue or
question in a few words.
[Type a line of input or `@abort' to abort the command.]
ASS maintenance and repair upgrade?
VERY IMPORTANT: Please enter any further details that might help the staff
address your issue. In the case of a bug, please try to include all information
necessary for the staff to research your issue: Exactly what did you do to
encounter the bug? What was the exact result? What was the exact text you
encountered? What result, exactly, were you expecting instead? Exactly what
steps could be taken to encounter the same issue again? If you have an issue
with a specific item, please include where we can find it. If you have an issue
with a ship, please include its exact name so we can find it. The less detail
we're given, the less likely it is we'll be able to fix the issue.
[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]
Hi, I don't see anything different about my ship. I looked in the status read
out and there's nothing there that indicates I purchased or added anything.
*
Thanks.
*
.
Do you want to review your support ticket before you send it?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y

out and there's nothing there that indicates I purchased or added anything.

Is this okay to send?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
Thank you. The staff have been notified of your support request. We do not have
full time staff coverage, but we will try to address your issue with minimal
turnaround time. You may use the SUPPORT command again to track responses to
your request.

l
[Starship "Emerald McKay"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a large leather couch, a decoy beacon
launcher, and a wormhole drive tracer here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

units.

[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, and a trash
can here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and down.
[Tactical Communication] Cilah Silverthorn transmits, "Lunar orbit just went on
alert."
Blake Madison says in a Candelarian accent, "Oh dear."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Oh joy."
Blake Madison says in a Candelarian accent, "Let's have a look."

[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The three-person flying wing "Wolf's Claws" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, and a trash
can here.

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.

A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal

Accord of Free Worlds.

[Starship "Wolf Pack"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a viral injection pylon launcher, a decoy beacon launcher, and a
wormhole drive tracer here.
Blake Madison, Lily Kaise, Akemi Bando, Joel Kringle, Johann Rowan, and Morris

repair lasser 1
Syntax:
  REPAIR <component>
  Such as: repair hull
  Or:      repair launcher 2
  Or:      repair stop
Valid components are: hull, sensors, FTL, launcher, turret, or STOP

[Starship "Wolf Pack"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and south.
(You are sitting.)

this drive can withstand three more jumps.

find some in the ftl drive."

one!"

[Starship "Wolf Pack"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at Nuevo Laredo; Docking Bay.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
Blake Madison, Johann Rowan, Akemi Bando, and Lily Kaise are standing here.
Morris Corlew is leaning against a wall.
You can go north and south.
(You are sitting.)

space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer

almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.

stations of unknown origin.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
high tech silver star print holovid, a compact red refrigerator, a blue plastic
food storage container, a clear plastic food storage container, Purr the
humanoid service robot, and Jewel the large violet glowing felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.

Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved black tee with a large neon pink starburst
appliqued on the front, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red
'XX' embroidered on the back left pocket, and a pair of leather thong sandals
with a white flowered print. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed
prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver
bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver
ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple
amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple
reinforced plastic phone holster, a sturdy navy blue canvas AEU backpack, and a
soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying a large crystal gold-trimmed goblet of Cape Myers Paradise
Vineyards Extra-Dry Prosecco in her right hand.
